1.text: Remember, Yahweh, what has come on us: Look, and see our reproach.

2.text: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, Our houses to aliens.

3.text: We are orphans and fatherless; Our mothers are as widows.

4.text: We have drunken our water for money; Our wood is sold to us.

5.text: Our pursuers are on our necks: We are weary, and have no rest.

6.text: We have given the hand to the Egyptians, To the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.

7.text: Our fathers sinned, and are no more; We have borne their iniquities.

8.text: Servants rule over us: There is none to deliver us out of their hand.

9.text: We get our bread at the peril of our lives, Because of the sword of the wilderness.

10.text: Our skin is black like an oven, Because of the burning heat of famine.

11.text: They ravished the women in Zion, The virgins in the cities of Judah.

12.text: Princes were hanged up by their hand: The faces of elders were not honored.

13.text: The young men bare the mill; The children stumbled under the wood.

14.text: The elders have ceased from the gate, The young men from their music.

15.text: The joy of our heart is ceased; Our dance is turned into mourning.

16.text: The crown is fallen from our head: Woe to us! for we have sinned.

17.text: For this our heart is faint; For these things our eyes are dim;

18.text: For the mountain of Zion, which is desolate: The foxes walk on it.

19.text: You, Yahweh, remain forever; Your throne is from generation to generation.

20.text: Why do you forget us forever, And forsake us so long time?

21.text: Turn us to yourself, Yahweh, and we shall be turned. Renew our days as of old.

22.text: But you have utterly rejected us; You are very angry against us.
